messages.message: I created an app. Then I deleted it. Then I go to myhub and click “Start building”. It takes me right back to build the app which I had deleted. It includes the document I previously uploaded. I expected to start with a clean slate…what is expected here?
Hi @Nathaniel Lehrer, did you delete the app or the build project? Deleting the compiled app does not delete the associated project that was used to create the app
yeah, you need to delete the project too
Is there a use case where a user would want to keep the project but delete the app?
Ah, I deleted the app. I didn’t realize projects are separate. That makes sense now.
Would it be simpler for the user to understand if deleting a project -> deletes the app as well (and not allow deleting of the app itself)
It makes sense to me that an app is separate from the project. I just didn’t realize there was a concept of “project” when I first went through the flow.
To be fair, it does say “Project”
:writing_hand: making a note in docs about this
@jtau i imagine a user who realizes they published the app to soon, but wants to go back to and fix their app may delete the app and keep working in the project to improve on it
Projects are mutable, whereas apps are not. We expect users to refine / edit projects multiple times.
